OG.content: logocentrism as most powerful ethnocentrism: the metaphysics of phonetic writing
OG.linkedContent: logocentrism as most powerful ethnocentrism: the metaphysics of phonetic writing

OG.content: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech
OG.linkedContent: history of metaphysics as history of truth, as the truth of truth, the debasement of writing, its repression outside (hors) of “full (pleine)” speech

OG.content: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided
OG.linkedContent: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided

OG.content: system of “hearing (understanding) -oneself-speak,” of the so-called noncontingent signifier, organizes: difference btwn worldy/non-worldly, outside/inside, ideality/nonideality, universal/nonuniversal, transcendental/empirical, etc. > dominated history of world during entire epoch
OG.linkedContent: system of “hearing (understanding) -oneself-speak,” of the so-called noncontingent signifier, organizes: difference btwn worldy/non-worldly, outside/inside, ideality/nonideality, universal/nonuniversal, transcendental/empirical, etc. > dominated history of world during entire epoch

OG.content: writing as secondary, as technique: a translator of a full speech present to itself, its signified, its other
OG.linkedContent: writing as secondary, as technique: a translator of a full speech present to itself, its signified, its other

OG.content: ideality of math, graphie, already questions “signifiant sensible,” never been absolutely linked to a phonetic production
OG.linkedContent: ideality of math, graphie, already questions “signifiant sensible,” never been absolutely linked to a phonetic production

OG.content: Aristotle’s phono-logocentrism: voice, spoken symbols, immediately proximate to the universal language of mental experience (pathēmata tes psychēs), closest to the thing, the signified
OG.linkedContent: Aristotle’s phono-logocentrism: voice, spoken symbols, immediately proximate to the universal language of mental experience (pathēmata tes psychēs), closest to the thing, the signified

OG.content: logocentrism is also phonocentrism
OG.linkedContent: logocentrism is also phonocentrism

OG.content: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration
OG.linkedContent: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration

OG.content: voice, phonè, s’entendre-parler, s’affecte lui-même (hearing-oneself-speak, affecting oneself), ideality
OG.linkedContent: voice, phonè, s’entendre-parler, s’affecte lui-même (hearing-oneself-speak, affecting oneself), ideality

OG.content: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…
OG.linkedContent: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…

OG.content: signified–immediate; signifier–mediate (exterior)
OG.linkedContent: signified–immediate; signifier–mediate (exterior)

OG.content: writing as metaphoricity itself: a simulated immediacy; w/in logocentrism: bad writing is finite, artificial, sensible; good writing is infinite, soul-writing, Book of God (natural)
OG.linkedContent: writing as metaphoricity itself: a simulated immediacy; w/in logocentrism: bad writing is finite, artificial, sensible; good writing is infinite, soul-writing, Book of God (natural)

OG.content: Saussure’s (Aristotle’s) phonocentrism: voix—state of soul; writing—symbols of voix
OG.linkedContent: Saussure’s (Aristotle’s) phonocentrism: voix—state of soul; writing—symbols of voix

OG.content: one should call this a model, and not a structure, of a certain kind of writing: it does not function perfectly, but there’s an ideal directing a function ([thus] never completely phonetic)
OG.linkedContent: one should call this a model, and not a structure, of a certain kind of writing: it does not function perfectly, but there’s an ideal directing a function ([thus] never completely phonetic)

OG.content: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence
OG.linkedContent: factum of phonetic writing commands our entire culture/science, not one fact among others > still, does not respond to a necessity of an absolute/universal essence

OG.content: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing
OG.linkedContent: if writing is mere “figuration” of language—it is exiled, cast outside, a double > unrelated to interior of the system: “internal system” is an epistemological exigency constituted by possibility of phonetic writing

OG.content: for Saussure & Husserl, teleology of phonetic writing makes the crisis of nonphonetic writing psychological errors, these nonintutionisms exile from sense; for Husserl, unlike Saussure, empty formalism part of his teleology > dialectical use of negativity should force us to rethink crisis (crisis not a mere accident)
OG.linkedContent: for Saussure & Husserl, teleology of phonetic writing makes the crisis of nonphonetic writing psychological errors, these nonintutionisms exile from sense; for Husserl, unlike Saussure, empty formalism part of his teleology > dialectical use of negativity should force us to rethink crisis (crisis not a mere accident)

OG.content: logos as sublimation of trace is theological from Plato to infinitist metaphysics: logocentrism…parousia, life w/out differance (name of God as name of indifference)
OG.linkedContent: logos as sublimation of trace is theological from Plato to infinitist metaphysics: logocentrism…parousia, life w/out differance (name of God as name of indifference)

OG.content: linearism, what Heidegger calls “vulgar concept of time,” inseparable form phonologism
OG.linkedContent: linearism, what Heidegger calls “vulgar concept of time,” inseparable form phonologism

OG.content: [see LEIBNIZ for logocentrism of universal characteristic despite its non-phonocentrism]
OG.linkedContent: [see LEIBNIZ for logocentrism of universal characteristic despite its non-phonocentrism]

OG.content: “logocentric teleology” is a pleonasm
OG.linkedContent: “logocentric teleology” is a pleonasm

OG.content: impossibility of pure phoneticization, always already undermines mute signifier > distinction btwn phonetic/nonphonetic is legitimate & indispensable though derivative re: synergy & fundamental synesthesia
OG.linkedContent: impossibility of pure phoneticization, always already undermines mute signifier > distinction btwn phonetic/nonphonetic is legitimate & indispensable though derivative re: synergy & fundamental synesthesia

OG.content: parousia of voice, presence to self of logos w/in voice, absolute hearing-oneself-speak, is a function responding to an indestructible but relative necessity w/in system that encompasses it
OG.linkedContent: parousia of voice, presence to self of logos w/in voice, absolute hearing-oneself-speak, is a function responding to an indestructible but relative necessity w/in system that encompasses it

OG.content: Chinese has phonetic elements but not logocentric [?] [cf. BSi p. 348]
OG.linkedContent: Chinese has phonetic elements but not logocentric [?] [cf. BSi p. 348]

OG.content: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]
OG.linkedContent: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]

OG.content: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)
OG.linkedContent: internal modification of phonocentrism (or logocentrism): Descartes’ cogito interiorizes ideality of eidos & substantiality of ousia; thereafter, objectivity takes form of representation, idea becomes modification of self-present substance, power of repetition in eidos/ousia acquires absolute independence, a substance in relation w/ itself, res cogitans, consciousness—auto-affection, lumière naturelle > surmounts the Evil Genius (Malin Génie)

OG.content: phoneticization of writing: science, religion, politics, economy, monetary calculation
OG.linkedContent: phoneticization of writing: science, religion, politics, economy, monetary calculation

OG.content: “structuralism” stuck in logocentrism, thinks it’s not
OG.linkedContent: “structuralism” stuck in logocentrism, thinks it’s not

OG.content: phonologism: exclusion of writing, authority accorded to human sciences
OG.linkedContent: phonologism: exclusion of writing, authority accorded to human sciences

OG.content: for Lévi-Strauss, each “comme” and “de même” authorize analogy btwn phonology and sociology: phonology exemplary as the example in a series, not a regulative ideal
OG.linkedContent: for Lévi-Strauss, each “comme” and “de même” authorize analogy btwn phonology and sociology: phonology exemplary as the example in a series, not a regulative ideal

OG.content: linguistic and metaphysical phonologism
OG.linkedContent: linguistic and metaphysical phonologism

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Lévi-Strauss] ethnocentrism of “society w/out writing,” an innocent, nonviolent society > but, wherever proper names are obliterated, there’s writing
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Lévi-Strauss] ethnocentrism of “society w/out writing,” an innocent, nonviolent society > but, wherever proper names are obliterated, there’s writing

OG.content: w/out writing no violence, no hierarchy, no deception [Derrida affirming Lévi-Strauss beyond his logocentrism]
OG.linkedContent: w/out writing no violence, no hierarchy, no deception [Derrida affirming Lévi-Strauss beyond his logocentrism]

OG.content: via Lévi-Strauss, Saussurianism exposed as ethnocentrism thinking itself anti-ethnocentric
OG.linkedContent: via Lévi-Strauss, Saussurianism exposed as ethnocentrism thinking itself anti-ethnocentric

OG.content: still ethnocentric to think West is bad, that writing exploits
OG.linkedContent: still ethnocentric to think West is bad, that writing exploits

OG.content: masturbation (“sexual” auto-affection) & writing totally indistinguishable inasmuch as each puts into play (met en jeu) the presence of the present, the life of the living [still, this totality is severely articulated and differentiated]
OG.linkedContent: masturbation (“sexual” auto-affection) & writing totally indistinguishable inasmuch as each puts into play (met en jeu) the presence of the present, the life of the living [still, this totality is severely articulated and differentiated]

OG.content: logocentric longing par excellence is to distinguish the two
OG.linkedContent: logocentric longing par excellence is to distinguish the two

OG.content: when Rousseau accuses Rameau of ethnocentrism [for privileging harmonic orientation toward music], his privileging of presence (melody) is a symmetrical counter-ethnocentrism
OG.linkedContent: when Rousseau accuses Rameau of ethnocentrism [for privileging harmonic orientation toward music], his privileging of presence (melody) is a symmetrical counter-ethnocentrism

OG.content: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè
OG.linkedContent: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè

OG.content: phonic auto-affection permits the epoch of man, epoch not of history but as history: greatest possible mastery, liberty, self-presence of life
OG.linkedContent: phonic auto-affection permits the epoch of man, epoch not of history but as history: greatest possible mastery, liberty, self-presence of life

OG.content: [in spite of Hegel’s follies, Derrida here affirms that concept of history is a concept of philosophy, that history is the history of philosophy]
OG.linkedContent: [in spite of Hegel’s follies, Derrida here affirms that concept of history is a concept of philosophy, that history is the history of philosophy]

OG.content: Hegel’s (folly) formula must be taken à la lettre: history is nothing but the history of philosophy, absolute knowledge is fulfilled (accompli) > what exceeds this closure is nothing, neither presence of being, nor meaning, history, philosophy—but [this nothing, writing] announces itself w/in thought of this closure, a place in the text which philosophy does not command
OG.linkedContent: Hegel’s (folly) formula must be taken à la lettre: history is nothing but the history of philosophy, absolute knowledge is fulfilled (accompli) > what exceeds this closure is nothing, neither presence of being, nor meaning, history, philosophy—but [this nothing, writing] announces itself w/in thought of this closure, a place in the text which philosophy does not command

OG.content: the epoch of truth, what Nietzsche calls abbreviation of signs [retreat of signifier?] [Derrida defends Nietzsche against reading that restores truth, fundamental ontology, in Nietzsche’s thought] [Heidegger’s reading?]
OG.linkedContent: the epoch of truth, what Nietzsche calls abbreviation of signs [retreat of signifier?] [Derrida defends Nietzsche against reading that restores truth, fundamental ontology, in Nietzsche’s thought] [Heidegger’s reading?]

OG.content: surface of page distributes itself differently depending on whether one is reading or writing (writing sensible/ reading intelligible > but, opposition disqualified: it’s impossible to purely separate writing/reading), coordination of hand/eye > that phoné must see itself, handle itself, in temporal linearity, this is only one way of speech [i.e. ethnocentric universalism]
OG.linkedContent: surface of page distributes itself differently depending on whether one is reading or writing (writing sensible/ reading intelligible > but, opposition disqualified: it’s impossible to purely separate writing/reading), coordination of hand/eye > that phoné must see itself, handle itself, in temporal linearity, this is only one way of speech [i.e. ethnocentric universalism]

OG.content: [Derrida is questioning very space of page, its determination by movement of hand, linearity, wonders about abandonment of boustrophedon, turning of the ox, writing by furrows > linear, phonographic techniques homogenize space—age of transaction?] [baby daddy]
OG.linkedContent: [Derrida is questioning very space of page, its determination by movement of hand, linearity, wonders about abandonment of boustrophedon, turning of the ox, writing by furrows > linear, phonographic techniques homogenize space—age of transaction?] [baby daddy]
